review: The rooms are very clean and comfortable, well equipped and a good size. I stayed 3 times over the last 2 weeks whilst visiting briefly on business and the room standard was consistently good. Late checkout is possible if you ask in the morning. I didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that. They have a shuttle service which leaves every 30 minutes but I prefer to take a taxi (17 dollars fixed fare to the airport and it only takes 10 minutes max).The only negative in my experience were the front desk staff, exceptionally rude and unfriendly, even by American standards. They just grunt at you. "Please" and "thankyou" don't appear to feature in their vocabulary. It would be a good idea for Hampton Inns to undertake some customer service training as first impressions really do count.There is a shopping area across the road which has a decent Cuban restaurant in it, other than that the area is surrounded by fast food outlets. Some local "takeout" food companies will deliver to the hotel. Complimentary coffee and water is provided in the room.For convenient access to the airport, and a reliable product, I would recommend the hotel. If you're used to the brash, no thrills, "you're wasting my time just by being here" attitude of the staff, then you may even enjoy your stay! I'll give somewhere else a try next time I'm in Miami.

review: So we stayed here for 3 nights. On the positive side, it‚Äôs very close to Times Square and the subway. The property has a good appearance and the staff was friendly. The breakfasts were standard Hampton Inn food - not great but not bad. The room size was okay but there isn‚Äôt much closet space or bathroom counter space. When we arrived we had four VERY small and flat pillows and asked for additional pillows. We also only had two bath towels. These towels were THE smallest and most worn out towels I have ever seen in a hotel; they should have been tossed a long time ago. We called and asked for more towels as well. It took another call but we eventually got the pillows and towels. I didn‚Äôt think it possible, but these towels were even worse than the two we had; the were frayed and literally had holes in them! The handle to the shower/faucet came off in my hand and water was spraying onto the floor. We eventually got it stopped - the handle never was fixed but we learned how to use it.Overall, not a bad place but not great either. It‚Äôs clear that this Hampton Inn was not using brand standard towels or bath mats. The room was quiet although the ‚Äòblackout‚Äôcurtain was coming off the rod. The room did have plenty of electrical and USB outlets.
response: Dear ShawnVandy,Thank you for your comments and for taking the time to post them on line. review: Stay away unless you want bedbugs, staff that won't do anything about it, and the loudest flight path of any airport hotel I have ever stayed in.My wife and I were treated rude from the bringing process of checking in. Front desk lady (Diana "Gonzalez", more on her later), pretty sure that is a fake last name as well, did not have the correct room for me although I booked 6 months in advance. That took forever while my jet lagged family stood around and waited.Finally get a room. Room 305. All was good until my wife went to get in bed and we found the first of many bedbugs (see photo). This was the only one we caught. We brought it to the front desk in a cup and the wonderful Diana treated us rude once again and offered no help except a refund (I booked the room on points). I told her I wanted her hotel to pay for a new room next door at Embassy Suites (also in the Hilton family so easily could have been done through corporate) but she refused. Didn't even offer to shuttle us, buy a cab, nothing. Sent us out the door with all our bags into the night.Unless you want jumbo jets flying directly over, and I mean RIGHT OVER, the hotel, bedbugs, and a real treat of a staff...go somewhere else.
response: Hello Mr.Jeremy M,We would like to thank you for your feedback as well as offer out utmost apologies for the inconveniences experienced. As Diana explained to you upon your complaint, we have never experienced bed bugs in our hotel and we did need to perform a cross examination with our pest department to evaluate if the bugs found in your room were in fact bed bugs. When we in fact did our cross examination there were no bed bugs found in the room, the bugs found while you were in the room were cancelled out from being bed bugs the second the examination started. Regardless of that we understood your frustration and Diana did offer a free night in points which could've been used for a room at the Embassy suites. In regards to the airplane noise, we are an airport hotel located right next to the airport. Our facility does have hurricane proof windows which shield most of the noise coming from the outside, as we receive little to no complaints about noise in the rooms.Again, we do apologize for the inconveniences experienced throughout your stay.

hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Boston Logan Airport
review: What do you expect: efficiency, cleanliness and value for money.The last two are typically a struggle with airport hotels. This one is an exception both ways.Efficiency: I struggled to determine the best way to get to the hotel as it is not directly situated at the airport. After a 40 minute wait.( shuttle will be there in ten minutes, shuttle will be there any minute,...) I took a taxi for the 4 minute ride. Cost 17.50. Total time 44 min. Which is no fun after a long day and a three hour flight. Not, when the hotel is actually 4 minutes away....The receptionist reimbursed me with 17 bucks in cash. After I refused to accept (as it does not bring back the wasted time and the missed sleep) I accepted a breakfast voucher.Room was spacious and immaculate. Good sleep. Worth 200$ for 'just' a clean room? Not so sure. But ok.Breakfast staff was of this unnatural/ artificial friendliness that I still have trouble to get used to in the US.I presented my breakfast voucher and ordered a scrambled egg. Had a cup of coffee and a slice of tast from the buffet along with a glass of orange juice.My surprised: a $16.50 bill. If I add the $17 from the voucher that would be over $30 for a mediocre breakfast.

hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Boston Logan Airport
review: I'm a Hilton fan. Love Hiltons brand and the Gardens are probably my favorite.Almost everything about this hotel was outstanding. Close to the airport and the rail... Making it very easy to get into the city. I prefer that style of stay.This part might not concern you directly but hang in there. We had a wheelchair accessible room, roll in shower etc. it was perfect for my wife who is in a wheelchair... Until we we had to take a shower. The water ran everywhere except for the drain... I was taking towels from the housekeeping cart and was literally mopping up soapy water for 3 days. Imagine stepping out of the shower into what just fell off of you.Here's where this might concern you.I told the front desk about the issue and they were concerned for sure. I received a call a few hours later asking if we wanted to change rooms. I said no, let's just credit us on the room. We were going to be out until midnight and our stuff was all over, we didn't want to move rooms in the middle of the night when we were checking out in the morning.We received approx. $40 credit a night, which was nice but not enough. The GM was not in, so I asked for he or she to give me a call. The front desk wrote this down on a notepad. It has now been a week, and I have not received a call.There is a advertisement on the desk in these rooms. It says, "100% Satisfaction guaranteed or your money back." I'm not asking for my money back... But certainly a little more than I was offered considering the situation.Customer service is a forgotten skill. Sometimes it's just a phone call and sometimes it's just decent follow through.The staff, front desk, restaurant and housekeeping were excellent, so were the drivers of the shuttles. Still hoping I hear from the GM.
response: Dear Wescoach41,Thank you for sharing your experience and we are truly sorry! We strive to exceed expectations for all our guests and we apologize that we fell short during your stay. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention as we have installed a flexible strip to keep the water in the shower and still keep the shower accessible to wheelchairs.Our General Manager would very much like to talk with you to further resolve this issue for you. Please contact us at your convenience. Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back again soon!Your Friends at the Hilton Garden Inn Boston Logan Airport
responder: Response from AndieVal, Manager at Hilton Garden Inn Boston Logan Airport

hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown South Loop
review: I watched this hotel go up and was very excited until the day of check in. What an absolute mess! The front desk staff and management is so confused and management extremely rude! I was here for 3 nights each day we encountered different issues. From the beginning: I booked 4 rooms online on 6/21/19 all under my name (the hotel opened end of May) for a football weekend with 6 of our closest friends. Upon visiting my daughter who lives across the street from the hotel I walked over and spoke to a front desk clerk named Shannon (who no longer works there). She was very kind, offered me pre-reserved room numbers and breakfast for 2 each day for all days and rooms I reserved. I called the Wednesday before arriving to confirm, spoke to Michael the assistant front desk manager who told me "We don't offer free breakfast, however I can change your reservation to the Homewood Suites (in the same building) who does. I don't think so as I had very good rate for grand opening and at the time the rooms were an extra $100.00 per night. Good Try Mike!. I thought the free breakfast was a perk of being a new guest in their new hotel, wrong! Fast forward, to the day before check in day, I called again to the front desk manager, Lorena to inquire again. Left a voice mail she never returned my call. On check in day, Lorena checked us in I asked why I didn't receive a return call no response. Went on to explain the whole Shannon/Michael/breakfast thing. She said the same thing no notes on my reservation but she reluctently gave us vouchers for breakfast. Thank you Lorena, it's not a big issue, however when you are your groups travel agent and promise them something that is promised to you it looks bad on everyone. On to check in, yes we did receive our rooms as promised they were all very nice. Only 2 of the 4 rooms were available at the 3pm check in promised. Was told housekeeping was short handed. Not our issue. Our last group checked in at 5:15 even though we all arrived together. While checking in a desk clerk changed the main name to another friend of mine on all 4 reservations. This created a MAJOR nightmare with questions and check in etc. On to Saturday, a housekeeper seen us leave at 8:50am, we told her we would all like our rooms cleaned as we would be out the most part of the day. Reutrned at 2:00pm not one of our 4 rooms were touched? Called the housekeeping supervisor who sent up extra towels no apology nothing! Went at 2:10 pm to the restuarant for a sandwich, thought it would be easier than room service. Nope the Restaurat manager told me to return at 5pm as they just closed. REALLY?? I had dinner reservations elsewhere no thanks. After dinner on Saturday night came back to our hotel bar with one very confused bar tender. 7 of the 8 of us in attendance, all ordered one drink. Never received a bill asked for one twice. He was making up prices as he went from person to person then when we started questioning him he was returning change to some of us not all. All the time that same Restaurant manager from lunch looked on. How professional is that? We had multiple other issues (I have already written to much) You get the idea of what a mess this place is. Michael even had the audasity to question and insult me in front of his other hotel guests. Once arriving at home I called Hilton Corporate immediately. Explained everything that happened and yes they restored my faith in the Hilton Brand once again. It was sad that it took that to get any resolve. The best part was I received an email from Taylor Smith asking if I wanted to discuss further with him on 11/13/19. I left him a voicemail that yes I did, it's now 11/20/19 still waiting on that return call. This hotel has multiple issues to fix before I ever return there which is sad as it is the perfect location. However from this day forward I will be staying at the Palmer House Hilton. The best hotel in Chicago, maybe this staff needs to go down the street for some proper training. So very sad for such a beautiful new hotel.
response: tsjkbart,Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience. While we understand that a dual branded hotel can be a new concept to many guests, I assure you the amenities between the two hotels do differ. While offering free breakfast since we are a new property sounds like an exciting option, it was not an option that our hotel has used. I am pleased that the team offered you the breakfast. Again, we do apologize for the inconvenience and wish you the best in your future travels.
responder: Response from HWS_HGI_Chicago, Manager at Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown South Loop

hotel: Hilton Garden Inn Houston Hobby Airport
review: I had checked in the day before my arrival and was disappointed that my room was not available at 2:35 pm. I was provided a room on the second floor by Ashley and she said that she would call me when it was available. I waited an hour and asked to speak to a manager and was referred to Ken where he told me that he had rooms on the first floor but that they were not yet ready for guests. This hotel opened in November and the rooms are not furnished for guests plus the lobby had three people submitting applications for positions! I had planned a cruise and was meeting my spouse in a few days and needed to wash some laundry and I noticed that the coin laundry was not available.On a brighter side, the rooms are configured nicely and there's more room. I enjoyed the tabletop where the big screen TV is positioned with clothes cabinets below and a workable desk station. I noticed plenty of reading lamps on the desktop and near the night stands so great job HGI. Great customer service was provided by Misty at the bar/restaurant and the breakfast selections (omelettes, fresh fruit, cereals, pastries) were plentiful. The hotel's location is down the road from my rental car agency so it's convenient.I really like the openness, and the vibe that this hotel emanates, and I hope that they work out the "kinks" soon. I'll be returning in March to give it another try.
response: Dear Ed,Thank you for your recent stay with us, we really appreciate it. Our check in time is at 3:00, and we try so hard to provide rooms for guest checking in early whenever possible. Being a busy airport hotel we are sold out most week nights so sometimes we are unable to check In guest early. review: Pros: Great location in the heart of the city, walking distance to many restaurants and sites. Nice bar (with happy hour) and restaurant to include room service. Room was postage stamp sized, but had a nice view. Very clean and modern, Keurig coffee maker, microwave, and fridge. The staff was also very nice and attentive. Cons: King sized bed was way too firm and not adjustable as many HGI's offer. Mattress rested on a hard wooden framed flat box (on the floor) without a box-spring. Wooden bed frame extended beyond the perimeter of the mattress, with hard, sharp corners that bruised our shins and feet several times throughout the night when moving around the room. Parking (valet only) was ~$50, which was painful, but not unusual for Seattle. The hotel offered many attractive amenities, but to me, a comfortable mattress that I don't bruise myself on throughout the night weights heavily. Investing in comfortable mattresses and rubber baby buggy bumpers for the bed frame corners would elevate my rating to "very good" and prompt my return. Barring that, I'm not likely to stay again.

I reported it immediately and a very nice and respectful gentleman who introduced himself as the head of house keeping came to speak with me. I showed him the bites over all both my arms. He then turned into a bug specialist and began to tell me those were not bed bug bites because they were not bleeding. OK! Whatever they were they itched like HELL. We checked out and days later we were still dealing with the effects. We tried not to scratch but couldn't stand it, of course that left all kinds off marks on us. All the while the hotel nor Hilton never followed back up. I sent more pictures to show the progression of the incident and still no response from Hilton. So I felt it was my duty to inform anyone who's thinking of staying at that beautiful hotel to be very careful. I personally will never stay there again.

review: We had a decent stay one night in January. It is a beautiful and new hotel and our experience at the front desk and with the valet who showed us around the hotel was great. Just Ok experience at the bar and issues with housekeeping that were dealt with appropriately before we left. Unfortunately, my experience with management (Fernando) and catering was AWFUL shortly after our stay. I was inquiring about having a large event and Rosie (a receptionist)was obnoxious. I tried to report it to Fernando (the hotel manager) and he could not have handled it worse. He was condescending, he would not let me speak, and he had all the facts wrong because he was a know-it-all. He was just rude and horrible. I am completely shocked Hilton would allow someone like him to be manager. I am in Miami 5-6 times a year. Would have made this one of my go-to hotels but because of the rudeness of these two employees I refuse to stay there until they don‚Äôt work there anymore. We obviously decided not to have the event of 100-150 ppl there and thank goodness we discovered how management is before booking the event. They missed out on us booking the event and all the hotel rooms booked for the event over a long weekend. That‚Äôs a lot of missed revenue. I would have rated higher for the stay but my experience after our stay was so bad I can‚Äôt rate it higher knowing management treats people this way. It is unacceptable. It‚Äôs too bad because it‚Äôs a nice hotel. I also don‚Äôt think charging $15 per night for parking is appropriate for this location. I was such a Hilton fan before this...I hope they fix these issues and we can try this out again with new staff one day. Like I said before...it‚Äôs too nice of a hotel to see it go downhill because of a few bad apples. I know from many stays at other Hilton properties that Hilton can do better and that especially Fernando (but also Rosie)are not up to par with Hilton hospitality. Super unfortunate it ended up this way.

hotel: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Miami Airport East
review: I booked this hotel because it advertised shuttle available to go to cruise ship terminal, and that was our reason for arriving Miami one day ahead of the sailing date. Found out the shuttle was independently operated not related to the hotel.The airport shuttle was efficient since this hotel was only less than five minutes from the terminal. Check-in was friendly and efficient, and the property was bright, clean and well kept. However, we soon found out that sound proofing within the room was poor. I had been staying in other airport hotels that did a much better job in sound proofing. The room's housekeeping was done well, and the bed was comfortable. Wifi worked without issues and the air conditioning was OK. The included breakfast was above average. The hotel management and staff were well aware of the lacking of dining providers nearby - only one Subway at the gas station across the street and one average Cuban restaurant within five minute walk. Hotel might consider providing transportation to better restaurants or suggesting some take out places. There was one homeless at the Subway parking lot and one at the hotel parking lot, pandering for money. It made the walk to the sandwich store in the evening a little uncomfortable. Staff did not mention there were other restaurants further out that would do deliveries. I did not realize this until I was on the way back from Subway when I saw a pizza delivery car pulled up to the hotel front.Overall, if one does not mind about the almost constant jet planes' taking off or taxiing noise, this would easily be a four/five star place.
response: Thank you for being our guest. We are glad you could take advantage of our shuttle service and that you were impressed with our comfortable accommodations. However, we are sorry for the inconvenience you had due to noise from the airport, an unfortunate characteristic of any airport location. Also, your feedback will be discussed with our front desk team to make sure we are consistent with our service delivery. We appreciate your business and hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back soon for a much better experience.Sincerely,Angel Troncoso,General Manager

When I was asking the Front Office how to reach the city center of Miami they couldn't tell me, the only thing they said to me was you can take a taxi of use uber.. The complimentary breakfast is.. eating with plastic forks, knifes and plates. At the buffet there is a machine that produces pancakes but it doesn't work so I asked one of the staff and she said to me that this is finished. Breakfast is available till 9.30 on weekdays but she said to me it was until 9.00, so no pancakes anymore at 9.10.. After breakfast we returned to our room but we couldn't get in, the battery of the door was empty so they need to changed it, this is something that can happen unfortunately. When we came back after a long day exploring Miami we found out that the housekeeping skipped our room. We went to to Front Office and they could offer us a new room but we don't want to pack up again so they brought us new fresh towel but nothing more to compensate.

hotel: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites North Seattle - Shoreline
review: Our son and daughter-in-law live in Northgate and this hotel was very convenient to their apartment, so we booked it for a weekend visit to see them. It was convenient for those purposes, but it's not really near anything else people might want to visit in Seattle.The neighborhood the hotel is located in is a little sketchy with lots of marijuana shops, auto part stores, pawn shops and the like surrounding it on a busy stretch of Aurora Ave. Once inside, however, it feels nice and has been upgraded nicely. The lobby is warm and inviting with a fireplace and large breakfast area, and the rooms are spacious and very well-appointed. Our bed was comfy in our King Efficiency Suite and we had plenty of room to spread out--except in the bathroom. It would be nice to cut into the room space a bit to expand the bathroom, or to put the vanity area outside the shower/toilet area. It's not a two-butt bathroom, that's for sure. :) But it was nicely decorated and had nice amenities and big, fluffy towels, so I will give them positive reviews for that.Our room was comfortable and had everything you could need. I liked the decor and the lay-out.The breakfast was quite good with lots of choices (cold and hot) and plenty of room for guests. No complaints there. I found the staff to be very helpful and accommodating throughout our stay.My biggest complaint would be the internet service. Although it was free, it was really bad throughout the hotel--so bad that I decided to go downstairs and use the business computer (located in the corner of the eating area) for a bit. THAT was even worse. It literally took me half an hour to bring up my airline confirmation and print a boarding pass. I wouldn't recommend trying to do any sort of business here, as you will be very frustrated.Other than that and the location, I would recommend this hotel for the customer service and the nice decor and free breakfast and free parking. It's a good choice if you need a place to stay in the north part of Seattle.
response: Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel comfortable and inviting. It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope that when you visit your family you will stay with us again.Sincerely,Chloe S.Sales and Marketing Manager
responder: Response from HIEXhotelStaff, Manager at Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites North Seattle - Shoreline

The mattress sucked. And when I say it sucked, when I sat/lay on it I was sucked down 30 feet as it was the worst mattress ever.2. The staff didn't know what a suite was. On check-in, I asked if a suite was available for free upgrade (I am an IHG Platinum member). At first, they said it would cost like $300 more, I politely informed them they were wrong, but I would stay in a regular room. So, then, after discussions with their general manager, they decided to 'upgrade' me to a suite. It was just two regular rooms with a door in-between. Not that sweet.3. Maintenance. The room I was in (vs my son and his friend) had a bathroom door that didn't lock and the shower curtain rod sagged so the curtain would not keep water (or heat) in. Annoying, but not the end of the world. FWIW, that was room 104.4. Location. Sorta a sketchy location. First thing I did in the am was go and make sure all the windows were still in my car...Pool was ok (my son and his friend like it) but nothing special. Hot tub was broken.

One day when we called the hotel from the LAX Airport to ask to send the Shuttle Bus in the night, the receptionist took the name and room nr. and still said there is no reservation! When I said we have already checked-in a day before, then he checked again and found out!Shuttle Bus to/from LAX Airport to the hotel - though the hotel provide shuttle bus when guests needed from the LAX Airport guests must have a local mobile to call the hotel. review: This was our 1st trip to New York. We came as a family of 4, 2 grown children at ages 18/15. The location of the hotel is excellent. Check in took minutes and we proceeded to room. The hotel has approx 20 floors we were a third way up. No issue in using lift. On entering the "family room" immediately you felt that the area was going to be cramped. Our view from our window was generators of building roof tops which were making a noticeable voice. Our children moaned immediately on entering and we knew this was going to be hard work for a 7 night stay. Also the room smelt stale, didnt feel fresh. The toilets were a sliding door from main room which again was not ideal. The bathroom was clean and functional. I did try and change the room but no other were available and after we had started our NYC site seeing plan we just put up with it as we were using the room to just sleep in. Breakfast was good overall, 4 hot choices, 2 types of egg and 2 types of sausages (pork / turkey). We were limited to vegetarian so could have eggs only, but good selection of bread/cereals/yoghurts and they had a self serv pancake maker. Good selection of Coffee/Tea/Juices. The reception are ok, but at the end I wasn't asked about our stay, to which I feel they are not bothered. The strongest part of this hotel is its location. 8 mins to Time Sq 4 mins to a variety of Subways worked great for us. Overall I would give 3.5 for this hotel. My recommendation is, it is ideal for a couple or a single person but definitely cramped for a family of 4 in a family room. If I was going to New York again as a family I would consider other options and pay extra for the space.

review: We came in LATE Thursday evening, close to midnight. Our cruise was leaving Saturday the 11th. Front desk was nice, helpful. Had lunch at the shopping complex which was really a tourist trap.We ordered an Uber Saturday morning to get to the port. It was convenient. It was a disaster for people waiting for cabs. The price was reasonable...it's just dirty and run down. Traveled with my husband and 5 + 3 year old. My parents had a room 2 doors down from us. Hotel rooms seemed more like a motel. The lobby and stuff is fine though. Stayed here since we joined the IHG club a couple years ago. We got a slightly better price than what was offered online.

I was given a govt. rate of $119 but that was only for Canadian Govt. employees. Nothing against our friendly neighbors but the US govt. discount was $219. I tried to contact reservations on their chat. After quite a pause I was told that there were no rooms available for that date. I told them that I was looking right at the reservation online and they had several rooms available. I closed out the chat and then called the reservation number. At first they told me that I would not be able to use the govt. discount. She said she could save me a room at the regular rate and I could cancel and re-book if it lowered. I told her that would not be necessary unless it was at the govt. rate. I want to make one thing clear. I am not cheap and don't expect something for nothing but to me I can't for the life of me understand why the Canadian govt. discount would be $100 cheaper a night. I could see if it was a few dollars. Then for them to tell me that the hotel was completely booked that date was an outright lie. Can someone enlighten me on these practices? Is this normal?

After that we started to notice a lot of details like the window handle was broken, so we couldn‚Äôt open it. The forks, knifes and spoons were all dirty. I was running late and called to ask for assistance on the phone, and I encountered the most rude and unhelpful person I have ever talked to by phone at a Hilton Hotel. The end result is that she told me if I didn't get there to check in in person I was at risk for losing my room after midnight. After finally arriving I was happy to hear I still had a room but was greeted by a front desk person who was just as uncaring and unhelpful as the person on the phone, and she lied to me about the occupancy of the hotel on top of that.Overall a very disappointing stay. Amer (I think I got the name right) and his staff gave us directions, got our car faster than I thought possible, and were generally amazing - without ever seeming to expect a tip.The bad - a lot else.We are diamond members. We got no welcome gift.My son and I came back the second day to find that our keys had been deactivated. Because the reservation was in my husband's name first, they made us contact him to allow us to get into the room. This despite the fact we had called in advance to make sure my name was also on the room. The manager was rude, and never apologized for us being locked out of our room. He was more concerned that I give him my old key to prove I had been in the hotel.Only one of the two elevators was in service during the time we were there. In an 18 story hotel this is a problem.The refrigerator in the room did not work (our lunch meat went bad).The toilet in the room kept running until we went back in and played with it.The staff I dealt with (other that the weekend manager) were great - but the elevator situation was a problem and they do not respond to customers when you call with requests.

review: I have been at the Homewood Suites for 2 nights and have 1 more to go, and so far I've been disappointed with my stay. Based on the reviews here, I expected a lot more.Firstly, the positives. You can't deny how great this location is- it's incredibly central, surrounded by great shopping and restaurants, and about 35 minutes from O'Hare if traffic is cooperating. The staff at the breakfast area are really lovely- friendly and helpful and patient with the hoards of people who descend on them every morning. My suite was spotlessly clean when I arrived and the rest of the property is well maintained as well.However, there are a few things I was not pleased to find. If you're expecting peace and quiet, this is not the place for you. Street noise, as well as noise from the hallway and your neighbors, is a near constant. There are also (understandably) a lot of families who stay here with small children, adding to the noise level.The AC in my room does nothing to control the humidity, leading to a stuffy, clammy atmosphere, even when it's running constantly. The linens and towels are not high quality- the hand towels literally disintegrate on your hands as you're drying them, leaving bits of fuzz and white fluff all over you. The free breakfast is basically a bunch of beige foods of varying quality- the fruit option this morning were blueberries that had clearly been thawed from frozen.Also, if you're expecting a welcome or thank you for being a Hilton Honors member with status, you won't find one here- I didn't even get a complimentary water bottle on check in. Overall, I had much higher expectations about the level of service and comfort at this property.
response: Hello and thank you for your review! We enjoy hearing from guests that are still in-house, because we still have the opportunity to make things right for you! Although we can not see the specifics of your room #, etc. here, please contact us right away so engineering can address the A/C issue you mentioned. We have not had any other complaints of this nature, so please give us a chance to correct as we're sure it's an isolated issue.Hmmm, our linens and terry are the same as other Hiltons, since it's the same standard, but we'll be happy to replace for you, just call us!Of course, we can not control noise from outside of the hotel, but if any other guests are disturbing you, (again), please call us right away!We also have plenty of water that is constantly given out, just give us a call! We hope to hear from you soon!
responder: Response from Jim_CHIHW, General Manager at Homewood Suites by Hilton Chicago-Downtown

review: Our family of five booked two rooms here for three days, two nights... Friday through Sunday with plans to go to the Shedds aquarium and Millennium Park. . First thing that bothered me was the location of check in. Check in is located on the 6th floor with valet on the 1st floor only. While that might not seem so bad for some it was it was for our family considering the elevator ran soooooooo slow and squeaked all the way up to the 6th floor. At check in the young lady and elevator guy were nice considering I was scared of the elevators after seeing how tall the hotel was. Our rooms were not 1804 and 1801. The valet guys were awesome! They delivered our bags up and even helped put some of food away in the fridge. Breakfast was horrible each day. Watery eggs and cold saugage the first day. The second day was watery eggs with cold tator tots and sausage. The pool with a gym was located on the 19th floor. It was nice and clean. Customer service at night was very unprofessional. It was Saturday night coming from the pool with the kids when we noticed two teenagers with pizza boxes and pajamas on. So I was thinking there is some sort of restaurant or something in the building. So my husband and I went to the front desk to ask. When we arrived there was the front desk young lady and the security guard. I asked if there was a resturant in the building, the security guard rudely says "People dont come down here at this hour asking questions. Use your phone" The desk clerk just handed me a pizza list and sent us away. I wont be back. If u looking for a hotel look elsewhere.

We hope you will consider staying with us in the future and giving us the opportunity to create an excellent experience.

hotel: Homewood Suites by Hilton Los Angeles International Airport
review: I checked into the hotel Sunday. I was in room 521. Upon arriving, I was impressed with the room design and it was fairly updated. I left for the afternoon and upon arrival in the evening, I noticed a bug on the floor. It ended up being a roach. What "bugged" me what I left my suite case open on the countertop (room had a small kitchen area). I grabbed a paper towel and killed the roach.I called the front desk and asked if they had a roach problem. The man advised no and that he's never heard of any issues. The agent answering didn't bother transferring to a night manager and honestly it didn't seem to bother him much. I wasn't going to make a big deal out of this but upon waking in the morning, I went back into the kitchen area (suitcase still open) and what do I see? Another roach. This time it was coming out of the coffee machine. I was disgusting having a pack of open candy 5 inches from the machine. I went to kill in and it went inside the machine. I went to grab my phone to record this (as I did the night before as well) to show the managers. I called down to the main floor and they advised they would change my room.But I leave this hotel with a few thoughts. Unless roaches are common and expected, how the heck didn't a supervisor, manager or anyone acknowledge this? By this I mean call, email, or write a letter apologizing. As a Diamond member w/Hilton Hotels. I'm super paranoid about roaches in my clothing so much I feel like I'm itching my body.
response: Gojcaj - the cleanliness of our guest suites is of the utmost importance to us, and we can't begin to describe how disappointed we are to hear of your experience. One of our managers will be in touch with you offline to make this right. We hope that you will give us another chance to earn your business should your travels bring you back to the LAX area.

hotel: Homewood Suites by Hilton Los Angeles International Airport
review: Ok, the place is new and gorgeous and rooms are very spacious and nice. But they are clearly still trying to get it together a few months into business. I have filled out a couple of surveys and spoken to the staff nicely about my concerns. The front desk staff is nice, but they seem to have a lot of going on and don't seem to be able to multi-task or stop and focus on the guest. (I should add that I'm a frequent traveler for my job, and I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond member. No one at their front desk has ever thanked me for my loyalty as they do at most all other properties. This tells me it's probably a training issue.)I always have to wait on the valet... ALWAYS. (Maybe have more than one at this busy LAX property and help the poor employee out as well as provide better service???)The complimentary breakfast is consistently pretty bad. The fresh fruit is always like it's old. The bananas in the uncut basket this morning we're not even close to ripe and still had a lot of green on them. The scrambled eggs were barely warm and there's never any cheese or salsa or anything to even try to doctor them up. It is a very clean space though for sure. The attendant is right on it.The restaurant has a nice menu. Tonight my dinner was tasty, but the mashed potatoes were not warm. The chicken and the brussell sprouts were nice and hot, over top of room temp mashed potatoes. Hmmm... Not sure how that happens.Yesterday there was no wifi in the hotel, and today there is no cable. WTH??? The maid came in today as I got back from work tonight. I left the room at 6 am. Seriously!?!I'm over it. I really want to like this place as I waited months for it to open as construction progressed, but I don't think I will likely stay here again, especially with $44ish parking on top of everything else. It is certainly the nicest HHonors property in the airport area, but I'm truly so disappointed. It shares the building w/ the Curio Collection H Hotel, so it is a very, very nice property. I guess I have to ask, If a Hilton Diamond member experiences these things and is treated this way, was does the average traveler have to look forward to??? Sorry Homewood Suites LAX, I speak the truth.
response: JDM0225 - thank you for your time in posting comments about your recent stay with us, and we appreciate your loyalty as a Diamond member with Hilton Honors. Feedback from frequent travelers like yourself is invaluable to fine-tuning our hotel, and we have shared this feedback with our team to use as a training tool, ensuring a positive experience for all guests moving forward. We hope that you will consider staying with us again to give us another chance to earn your business.
responder: Response from InterstateHotels, Manager at Homewood Suites by Hilton Los Angeles International Airport

hotel: Homewood Suites by Hilton New York/Midtown Manhattan Times Square-South, NY
review: We booked 2 suites in this hotel. We split the family up into a group of 3 and 2. The rooms are very small (normal for NYC) and generally have a king size bed and a pull out. This is meant to be for up to 3 people. It was not big enough for me and we had requested 2 beds in each room but did not get them as apparently they only have a limited number of rooms with this layout. So our 2 person room was very uncomfortable.Breakfast was included and the food is not bad but there are simply not enough tables which means you are hanging around for a while waiting to grab a table, This is never too easy when there are 5 of you.They have 3 lifts - you'd think that was enough? You'd be wrong over the 4 days we were there we always squashed into a lift with at least 6 others. Not the end of the world but it was annoying and made it all feel too busy,All of that is negative.On the plus side the staff are very good and work very hard especially the breakfast crew who are constantly on the go cleaning the tables that people are waiting for. The hotel is clean and every request for extra towels was met quickly and efficiently. The location is very convenient for the subways and walking to Times Square is a no more than 10-15 minutes.If you are a family looking for a budget stay in NYC with no frills then this is better than most. In short a base to explore NYC from then this is fine. If you want a few more hotel 'type' facilities then don't book.So yes it was poor and only 2* for us but of our kids were younger - less than 10 then it would have been fine.
response: Thank you for choosing the Homewood Suites by Hilton! We would like to apologize for the inconvenience during breakfast. We also offer breakfast togo in those moments. Aside from that we hope you will give us the opportunity to make your next visit a fantastic one.Nicolas RambajueOperations Supervisor

review: Like most others have said this place is cool, very nice remodel with attentive staff and some great amenities, but i will not stay here again because of who i am. I am a very light sleeper and i do not think there is one room here that gets less than insane freeway noise. The doors do not seal to the hallways either, so expect to hear other guests talking and if you are near it you will hear the elevator. because of the unique shape, the hotel rooms are probably the smallest i have stayed in, with definitely the smallest bathrooms possible. Beds are very comfortable, some of the best i have used, without that i may have not slept at all, even with earplugs. I usually mask any noise in most hotels by running the bath fan and ac fan at full during the night but there was not a bath fan and the ac fan had a mind of its own and turned on and off throughout the night regardless of settings. The pool is nice but not warm in comparison to most and there is no hot tub. They have a nice small outdoor fireplace that is on in the evenings. the gym is small but looks over the pool and have quality treadmills and ellipticals.The restaurant/lounge on the top floor is a gem and reminds me of a vintage elite country club with a great view.I love the tip free atmosphere.the complimentary valet service is probably normally a nice touch, but record rains and below average temps during our visit made for uncomfortable waits(it would have been nice to just go get our own car when we wanted to).all in all, if you are a sound sleeper and only traveling by yourself or as a couple you will probably like this place, otherwise i suggest doing as i will and shop around further.

You can always stop by WEST for drinks or dinner.Please let me know if there is anything else i can do for you.Thanks,Vicky EscalanteMarketing Managervescalante@hotelangeleno.com

review: This hotel is a mess. To cut to the chase and summarize the problems or issues I had during my stay there this week:The air conditioning in my room did not work. review: This is the second time I have stayed at this property because the first time was outstanding experience. This time not so much. I am getting angry just writing this review reliving the experience. Everybody at the front desk especially Mandy were very professional and pleasant and quick to recognize me as a Diamond Elite Member, which is always nice. I spend at least 200 days a year in hotels, so it matters. Now for the part that makes me angry. Upon check in I always inspect the beds, bedding and towels to make sure they are fresh. At this check in I did my normal routine, pulling back blankets to find several hairs from previous occupant and what is obvious wrinkles from previous person. I complained and it was made right, with a fresh sheet change. During a two week stay I ask for a full room service only on day 7, and leave my trash outside the door, get my own towel exchanges when needed etc. I should be a housekeeper's dream. I also mark the bottom sheet of my bedding to make sure the housekeepers are doing their job so I can calculate the size of their tip upon check out. Day 7 arrives, expecting a full service I leave for the day of work and arrive to what appears to be a fully cleaned room. Oh no, there it is, my little writing, on the bottom sheet. Look, don't try to pull the wool over my eyes. Housekeeping didn't do her job as she should have. There were still pieces of paper on the floor, stickiness on the bath counter, etc. Yes, the towels were changed, some air freshener sprayed in the room, and the bed straightened, but that was it.Of course I mentioned it to the front desk, who were apologetic enough and remedied the problem. The soap, conditioner and shampoo is is a dispenser on the wall in the bath, towels were thick and fluffy, bed was firm with several pillows of different firmness. Wall air/heat unit worked wonderfully. Breakfast was the typical fare, but the highlight is the cinnamon french toast. I nice change from waffles. Rooms in the back of the hotel are more quiet, and away from the smells of the restaurant that shares the parking lot. Parking can be limited on the weekends especially because they share the lot with that eating establishment. Internet was fast and reliable. They have a big advertisement bill board in the lobby for the restaurant and their guide t.v. channel advertises the place as well. A simple suggestion, they should work with the place and get the guest a discount.
response: Hello AngelaHansen84116, I am so glad to hear that you had a great experience at the front desk and I will make sure to pass along your message to Mandy! I am also currently working with our housekeeping team to make sure that what you experienced does not happen to you or to anybody else in the future. Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any additional information and/or concerns at Christine.Kim@hotelnexusseattle.com. Thank you and we look forward to seeing you in the future. Warmest Regards, Christine Kim
responder: Response from HotelNexusFOM, Front Office Manager at Hotel Nexus, BW Signature Collection

review: It's close to exactly nowhere most people would visit. The first room I was in was totally infested with ants. And it's right next to a hospital, so there are constant sirens. The beds were both hard as a rock.

review: The hotel itself is in a good location, the rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The service is inconsistent though. Our front desk check in lady was fantastic. So helpful and when she realised it was my birthday, sent a complimentary bottle of champagne to the room. The rooftop bar manager was also lovely and couldn't have been more helpful. Sadly, as we already had plans for my birthday evening we didn't have time to drink my champagne, so I left a note on it for the maid to say please don't take this as we want to drink it later. We came back from our day out and needless to say she had taken it. Also she never left us water in our room. Having spoken to the cleaning manager, she said she would sort it out and that should not have happened re the champagne. She sent us up some water with another guy, but no word about the champagne. Even if she said there was nothing she could do I would have been upset, but understood. To just do nothing and not respond though was poor and I think pretty rude.Beware re the taxi too. When we left we asked about taxis and a woman on the desk said she would get a price. In fact she went ahead and booked one. We said how much is it to JFK and she said $75 (plus we would be expected to tip). I said but it's a fixed fare if we get a yellow cab and she said it's not and that we would be on the meter, which would be more expensive. I knew that not to be true and sure enough, the yellow taxi fare is $53 fixed rate. So with the tip, we saved about $20. It's not the money, but having been to NYC many times I knew the fare was fixed. To mislead travellers (as I'm guessing there is a kick back to the reception staff for referring taxi rides to a company) is not good. It's such a shame as the staff that were good, were really good.
response: Thank you for sharing your feedback of your recent stay with us and glad to hear you enjoyed your birthday weekend with us as well as the complimentary drinks offered at our rooftop, cupcake platter and bottle of prosecco provided to you complimentary as well. Our team truly try to go above an beyond for our guests, especially those celebrating a special occasion. Our housekeeping team were addressed on the matter of the prosecco you think went missing from your room and a follow up should have been done that same evening, I believe our Director of Experience has been in contact with you regarding this.Our car service is a very convenient option for our guests as they are readily available. New York City's yellow cabs, licensed by the New York City Taxi & Limousine Commission, offer a flat rate service of $50-$70 from JFK airport to Manhattan as well as anywhere in Manhattan to JFK, excluding tips and tolls. Tips should be around 15-20% of the total price and are common for the good service. Our car service pricing includes the tip as well as the tolls-if you were asked to tip on top of this please inform us as this would not have been correct of the driver and also unusual.Again, we appreciate your feedback and very glad your birthday was a memorable one!Nalini SullivanGeneral Manager
triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
responder: Response from NaliniSullivan, General Manager at Hyatt Herald Square New York

review: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Chicago Midway on February 20th, 2016. That night, my daughter sat up in her bed. When I asked her what was wrong she mentioned that she saw a bug in her bed. When I went over to take a look, I noticed that it was a bed bug. I immediately went down to the front desk to request a new room. Once we made it to the new room it was clear that my daughter and my Wife were still uncomfortable being in the hotel. We ultimately decided to leave the hotel. I captured photos of the bed bug in the room and the front desk clerk told me that I would need to send the photos to the site manager before checking out In order to be considered for a refund. This all occurred around 1:15am and the front desk clerk said that there would be no one to issue a refund until 8am. We left for another hotel and I returned the next morning only to be told that they would have to conduct an investigation that would involve a pest control company and if bed bugs were found, they would issue a refund at that point. Obviously they did not find any bed bugs during their investigation. The fact is that I saw the bed bug myself and now they cannot find them. Based on the fact that the Hyatt Place Chicago Midway will not be honest about the presence of bed bugs in their hotel, I feel obligated to share my story in efforts to help all consumers make a better choice. There are several hotels that are much nicer and at comparable prices in the same area. I advise you to pick somewhere other than Hyatt Place Chicago Midway.
response: Thank you for your feedback. We have procedures to follow in these instances to verify authenticity of these kinds of accusations and to ensure that we properly handle any instances of bed bugs, were the claims validated. In this instance, you were being very evasive with the staff and refused to produce the evidence. When the staff did a thorough inspection of the room and nothing was found, we called in a major pest elimination company to inspect. They also found no evidence of any insects up to and including bed bugs. We have several procedures in place to keep pests from being found in our guest rooms. This claim was found to be less than genuine.
responder: Response from HyattPlaceMDW, General Manager at Hyatt Place Chicago Midway Airport

The pool was quite nice and seemed fairly well maintained; except it is not heated. There are no amenities near this hotel and it is a bit tricky at first to find (a U-turn is needed on the freeway). We were skeptical after reading the review about the cockroaches, but we never saw any and we were looking for them. There were a couple other bugs... review: Let me start by stating that this review is for the management and their policies, not the hotel itself. I was going to be passing through L.A. and booked one room for one night at the Lexen through Expedia. Unfortunately for me, I used the autofill to enter my info and ended up making a reservation for the day before I arrived. I noticed the error that same night and tried to change my reservation but they were completely booked for the night I was going to be in town. I called the Lexen directly but was unable to get a hold of someone. Expedia called on my behalf but they said the front desk staff said the issue would have to wait until the following morning when the manager arrived. When I arrived in L.A., (I ended up staying at the BLVD and highly recommend it!) I took the time to go personally to the Lexen but the front desk employee told me the same thing: it was a matter for a manager but she was not on the premises, so they asked me to return hours later. Long story short, I was never able to talk to a manager until days later over the phone (I had already left L.A.) and after my many attempts at talking to an administrator, I was told the policy of the hotel was simply NO refunds. I understand it was my mistake and the policy is clear on their website. My review has the purpose of warning those who are considering booking at this hotel in the future: THEIR BOTTOM LINE IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN YOUR SATISFACTION. Despite the fact that the hotel doesn't seem to be wanting for business (they were completely booked), they had no interest in making any service recovery efforts, even for an honest mistake. I have dealt with businesses before where they happily refund money for services that were not provided, even if they have a policy of no refunds because they acknowledge that everyone makes mistakes and more importantly, they understand that in the service/hospitality industry customer retention through service recovery is essential. The management at Lexen was more interested in keeping my money, even one room for one night's worth, than in establishing a good reputation.
response: Sol,Thank you for taking the time to leave a review.I apologize for the inconvenience and I understand your frustration. Unfortunately, we have certain policies set in place that we are required to uphold, including our strict 24-hour cancellation policy.We cannot adjust our policy for just one guest, while expecting to deliver the same, exceptional service to our other guests. I hope you can understand this, and that you would consider actually staying with us in the future.
responder: Response from LexenHotelNoHo, Manager at Lexen Hotel - North Hollywood

review: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during an 18 day tour around the west coast of the USA. This resulted in quite a few hotel experiences, some good, some not so.Staff : I would describe the reception staff at The Lexen as 'bored'. Often they were not at the desk and when traced were more often than not on their phones, either talking or typing. On arrival I asked for local info and received a very disinterested response so didn't try again. The cleaning staff do not speak any English so I would advise against asking them anything (not a criticism).The hotel is small as described. There are 4 floors. All rooms appear to look onto the central courtyard where the bar is located. The bar is hardly used (can it be justified?) however as it is open from 5pm until 11pm each night and as a result the music, which is played loudly, can be heard from your room. As can the glass bottles being cleared after the bar closed. I did ask if there was another room but told abruptly no (I got the impression this is a common question). The music from the bar being audible in your room when you want to sleep is the one and only reason I world not recommend this hotel. Why, if the bar is empty, can the music not be quieter? In fact, as it is a social area rather than a pub environment, why do all the room occupants have to listen to this every night (some of whom also have children). I can accept in some hotels outside noise is an issue, but can't really accept noise generated by the hotel design itself.The rooms : the room itself was absolutely fine. Two queen beds, comfortable. Good shower and bath. Safe, small fridge, iron and hairdryer. There is also a small coffee machine in bathroom.Breafast: there is a small breakfast room which each day did not have enough seats for the guests...and the max I saw there any morning was about 20. There are options of bananas, apples, porridge pots, bread and bagels and muffins. The is a coffee machine (available 24/7) which does cappuccino, latte, Americano etc nice touch). However, this is the only hot drink option at breakfast time so a queue develops (including housekeeping staff?) and the machine has to do a reheat cycle every so often which takes about 5 mins. Suggest some black coffee available separately for those who do not want a speciality coffee may help with queue. The coffee machine is located next to the only toaster in the corner of this room. As a result, this area is busy even with 5 people and is not really fit for purpose for a hotel with 40 rooms. Not much else I can say about breakfast, filled a gap.Gym:there is an air conditioned gym with 2 x treadmills, an elliptical trainer, a recumbent bike, a functional trainer, some very dirty yoga mats and a gym ball. There is a water machine and hand sanitiser but nothing to clean the equipment after use?? Suggest some sanitiser spray and wipes.Garage:as mentioned $10 dollars a night.Deposit :$250... Only hotel we stayed in that took such a large amount. Yet to see how long it takes to get it back.Location : North Hollywood (NoHo) seems a nice neighbourhood. There is a park across the road which is good if you jog (about 0.9 mile lap). There are homeless people in the park but we soon realised that is unfortunately the same all over the city. They gave me no hassle when I ran there. There is a 7-11 round the corner and plenty of places to eat. A lot are counter service. I would hight recommend Daves Hot Chicken on Lankershim - queues out the door says it all.The red line metro is nearby and will take you downtown. We took the metro to Hollywood Boulevard and also to Universal. ($1.75 single trip of $7 day pass) $2 to buy a TAP then load it at the station.To conclude my many thoughts on this hotel. It seems to me alot of thought went into the actual room design and theme of the hotel, but the practicality of the bar location being adjacent to rooms and the breakfast room let's it down, not to mention the general feeling the staff couldn't care less.As I type this I can hear the bar music and know I will not be sad to see when I leave this hotel.I had high hopes for the Lexen from the reviews (some of which I think are frauds looking at the one off reviews and user names), however it was a disappointment for me personally.
response: Thank you for taking the time to go into so much detail regarding your stay here; we are pleased that you had an enjoyable time, and the details that you have provided should be of great assistance to others thinking of visiting this area. We are sorry for the aspects of your stay that did not please you, but we hope that this will not deter you from staying with us again, we would love to host you on a future occasion.Best Regards,Customer Care TeamLexen Hotel North Hollywood

review: The Maison 140 boutique hotel is a very unique small hotel decorated by Kelly Wearstler. Picture late 60's boudoir mixed with 1920's french noir influence. There really ins't a lobby per-se. Just a small check in area and a cute, dark little bar to left.The hotel is literally right next door to the fabulous Peninsula and is located in the heart of Beverly Hills. Perhaps a 10 minute walk to Rodeo Drive. Starbucks, Teavana, and some other smaller cafes are a stone's throw from the hotel on Little Santa Monica Blvd.Please note, the hotel is a former apartment building. One of my main criticisms of the hotel is the musky, old smell throughout the building and in the room. A somewhat powerful smell and unfortunately not what you expect when staying at a luxury boutique hotel in Beverly Hills.The room itself was good. The decor was great (very Viceroy-ish). The bed was very comfortable and the A/C (while loud) was refreshingly cool! The bathroom had great style, although it is quite small. The shower pressure was good and the toiletries (Neil George) were great! I took a look at the Room Service menu and the prices were identical to the prices at the Peninsula. That didn't make sense since Maison 140 is nowhere as luxurious as the Peninsula.There was some wear and tear in the room that could have been easily repaired by management.Service was fine. Standard. Nothing expectional. Parking is $30. Standard for the area.Would I stay there again? Yes, only if the price was right and if the Peninsula was sold out.
response: Hello TravelLawyerOC,Thank you for your detailed review. We will be sure to read your comments to our team and look to see where we can make improvements.Kind regards,
responder: Response from Gnell A, Manager at Maison 140 Beverly Hills

review: I stayed at the Maison 140 recently while traveling on business. My options are limited since I have to travel on a government rate, but I probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again.The hotel bills itself as the former residence of the actress Lillian Gish. It has lost all semblance of a private residence, and feels rather more like a flop house... When I can I like to stay in smaller hotels, but this one has little charm. The place is really quite tired. My room was small but fine for one person (a "Parisian" room--it would have been very tight for 2)--the bathroom was tiny.As the hotel does not have central A/C, there are individual units mounted through the walls. Mine was a bit noisy and cycled on and off about every 60 seconds. If you're a light sleeper, this might be a problem for you. Having said that, I did not hear noise from the hallways or other rooms, so other guests did not bother me. I don't know how full the hotel was when I was there.My room looked out over a parking lot in the back--not sure what the rooms on the opposite side look out on.The service was quite friendly at check-in and check-out, and when I had some questions about the neighborhood the woman at the desk was cheerfully helpful. The location is not quite in the center of the Beverly Hills scene, but still convenient--maybe a 10-minute walk to Rodeo Drive.Overall, given the location this is a good value for the money, but it's definitely no-frills, and next time I'm in town I'll probably look for one of the larger hotel chains that will take my business rate.

They gave us a great upgraded room as we were staying on a first responder discounted rate, as well as great recommendations for things that were open close by. The location was great. review: The location in the Lower Anne part of Seattle is good for a stay in Seattle, with access to many sites to visit and nearby places to eat. review: An pleasant travelers' hotel (2-3 stars), but it was a great deal with a Groupon discount of $132 off the rack rate. The hotel room was discounted to $97 using the Groupon + energy/utility surcharge $2.80 + tourism tax $2 + sales tax $8.60 + hotel tax $6.99 = $117.39, which included wifi and gated parking. In high season, this room would easily go for two or three times the amount I paid -- Seattle no longer enjoys the sensibly priced hotel rooms it used to even as recently as ten years ago.The building is older but the hotel itself has been renovated. My room was very standard, approaching basic, but it was very clean, quiet and comfortable. It had a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker (coffee, tea, popcorn provided), tv, clock radio, hair dryer and the usual assortment of soaps and lotions. My room had an iron, ironing board, a valuables safe large enough for a big laptop, and an electric heater/air conditioner.The only downside was the bathroom's unbelievably powerful bathroom exhaust vent. It sounded 24/7 like a jet plane was preparing to take off as air was sucked out the vent, which also made the bathroom so cold it might have been possible to freeze one's derriere to the porcelain! I quickly found a piece of paper and held it up to the grille of the exhaust vent and the vacuum action sucked the paper so tightly to the grille that the paper didn't move all weekend! With the bathroom door left open and the exhaust vent restricted, the bathroom warmed up enough to be comfortable.Off the main floor foyer, complimentary coffee was available, as well as an exercise room, a computer/meeting room, and a Starbucks store also adjoined the lobby. The rooftop observation deck afforded city views and the hotel's Lower Queen Anne location had several restaurant options nearby. Downtown was a good long safe walk or a short bus ride away. Bikes were also available for a reasonable rental fee.All-in-all, combined with friendly staff and a discounted room rate, my stay was very enjoyable and I would gladly stay there again at the $117 all-in price.
response: Hello GadgetBC,Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us, and for providing us with your feedback about your time. I'm glad you were able to get such a great deal with our recent Groupon promotion! It's true that the demand in Seattle has made those lower prices hard to come by. Too many people have realized Seattle is such a great place to visit! I can confidently say that we always shop our competitors to stay affordable, but "affordable" in July is just nowhere near "affordable" in December or January.We were purpose-built from the ground up back in 2001, and regularly "shop" around our competitors to see what needs to change, while staying simple and comfortable. I hope you found everything you needed in the room!I'm very sorry you were as irritated as you were by the ventilation system in the bathroom. The machinery on the roof essentially pulls air up to ventilate the bathrooms, and on floors 2-6 it can't be controlled. I imagine (though I'm not certain) you were on the sixth floor. Not everyone is bothered by the white noise, and I wish we had known to have offered you a room on a lower floor. If you stay with us again, please mention this so that we can make sure you're comfortable!Again, thank you so much for your patronage and feedback. I'm glad you enjoyed your time in Seattle, and we would love to host you again.Best Regards,Kelsey AsplundFront Office Manager
responder: Response from Mediterranean-Sea206, Front Office Manager at Mediterranean Inn

review: I've stayed a couple of times at this hotel for business with this trip being my first time to experience the upgraded rooms.First, the location is very convenient to the airport with free shuttles between the hotel and airport. There is a fee for parking and sometimes finding a spot can be a challenge. The parking lot is shared with a Residence Inn and Courtyard.Check-in was easy and quick. The lobby offers nice seating and a bar right next to the check-in. The concierge lounge is off the lobby and offered a good selection of food and drink.This was my first time experiencing the newly renovated rooms. Modern upgraded bathroom with a nice move from carpet to "wood" floors. Very large flat screen TV with plenty of space to work. My only complaint and for me it is a big one is that I had a connecting room which meant that I heard very clearly the person in the next room. I heard them on the phone or when they were in the shower. It was almost as if there was no door or sound barrier between the rooms. This may be because of the doors used or it may be due to the uncarpeted floors allowing sound to carry. I would highly recommend asking for a non-connecting room unless you enjoy hearing your neighbor.There is an on-site restaurant which I did not use as well as a nice shop where you can buy "to-go" items if you want to go back to your room to work. The selection was good and the food was not bad.A good hotel that could be great if the sound issue is fixed between connecting rooms. Convenient location to Miami airport with free shuttle. Friendly staff and reasonably priced for Miami. Parking is not free and can be challenging to find a spot if the hotel and surrounding hotels are busy.

review: I picked this place for the price as hotels and motels are pricey in Santa Monica. Check in was great, we were let in at 1:30 pm when we arrived.Got up to room 37, it's a little tight getting up the narrow stairs and your door is crammed with 4 other rooms all entering and exiting the same way.The room is pretty spacious for a motel. A safe and small closet area are provided. The bathroom has a miniature sink and a small toilet area and a hallway sort of shower.The internet provided would work on my iPhone, but not on my Macbook Pro for some reason. I could not get it to connect to either internet routers and it would just say no connection available really odd.The major problem was at night. The walls are paper thin. The people next door to us in room 36 were literally bouncing off of the walls. Running around, banging into walls and jumping around. Every few seconds there would be a loud thump against the walls and yelling. This went on from 11 pm to 2 am. It was very hard to sleep. I even had a dream that gymnastic students were next door. The cars passing by on the street can be heard too, it's an extremely busy street. Even with earplugs I could hear it.The next morning these crazy people were up at 8 am making noise again. We had a very poor nights sleep and were so relieved we'd switched from 2 nights to only 1 before we arrived. I don't think I could handle another.When I went to check out at 11:05 am at checkout time there was no one in the office. I rang the bell and waited and waited. No one was there. I left my card there. I never got a receipt so I was a little ticked off.I mean it's clean and it's not too far from the beach. But it's a little hard to enjoy a motel stay if you can't sleep. I always bring ear plugs but that didn't drown out the thumping and the cars. I don't even know if there was anyone at the front desk nor did I feel like anything would be done to quiet rowdy guests at a motel.It's not the worst place, but it wouldn't be my pick next time I go to Santa Monica. I'll spring for the extra to get a hotel without paper thin walls.
response: We are very sorry that you had a bad experience that night. As far as the traffic noise we are installing a triple glass windows in three weeks and hoping to solve that problem. We always have someone on front desk at all time. During the check out time the clerk may be out in the court yard for few minutes. Have a great day.
triptype: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
responder: Response from oceanparkinn, General Manager at Ocean Park Inn

review: This place got great reviews but you had better be ready for drama if you het the wring room.Where can I start? If you like Dracula films you'll love the design. If you want to sleep, forget about it.Visually it's dark and weird and creepy, which can be tons of fun. But (and this is a huge BUT) the room was a sauna and it has a giant radiator that was scorching hot to the touch. Even when you turned it off made no difference. It was so hot i went through 3 bottles of water. You het those cost $10.00 each.When someone flushed the toilet up above/next door, it sounded like a bomb went off. Every time. There's a sign that says "the ocean air brings a musty smell so turn on the atomizer", which didn't work. The musty smell had nothing to do with the OTHER smell, which was either backed up pipes or ghosts....who can tell?!?!? The room has a door that looked like a closet...that SURPRISE....led to another room. Is there a lock on your side? No. Is there one on their side? Sure! Do you feel safe in any way? No.When you arrive they'll give you a little note that says this is a historic building with idiosyncrasies. As soon as i read that I knew I was in for it and that this was my "don't call the front desk to complain because the hotel is sold out" message.Oh and the staff were friendly.
response: Dear Vee33 Mag,Thank you for your review of Palihouse Santa Monica, I am sorry to hear that you did not have the best experience with us here. I understand that you found the heating in the room to be too warm but a simple call to the front desk and we would have been more than happy to have taken care of this for you. We are working on installing brand new air conditioning and heating units so hopefully this will help if you decide to give us another try in the future. And yes we do have bottled water in the minibar for purchase but of course if any of our guests are experiencing an issue such as you had; we will certainly do everything possible to remedy the situation without an added expense. We do have a wonderful ocean breeze here in Santa Monica, and that can leave a scent that some adore and some may not, which is why we have the option of an atomizer in the room, I am sorry that yours did not seem to work but again a quick call to alert our helpful and friendly staff and we would replace that right away as we have plenty of extra on hand.We do have some adjoining rooms with connecting doors and those doors are locked at all times and can only be opened by a front desk agent with a key, no guest can ever open those doors, I understand your concern with this but I can assure you they are completely safe and secure.And I am glad you received our wonderful welcome note that lets guests know about some of the wonderful features and amenities that we provide here at Palihouse and as you mentioned we do have some idiosyncrasies, being a historical landmark building we feel as most of our guests do that it only adds to the charm, it in no way indicates that we are here to give anything less than the best service possible when a guest calls the desk for assistance. I am really sorry to hear that you did not reach out to us with these concerns during your stay and allowed us the opportunity to address these issues for you to assure you had a wonderful experience, that being said I hope I was able to address your concerns and I do hope you will consider giving us another try if decide to visit beautiful Santa Monica again.Best,Greg Shortt | Housemaster

review: Myself and my family stayed here in October. Great location and the room fit all 6 of us. When we arrived the weather was hot and the apartment windows were all open so we didn't notice that the gas cooker was leaking gas into the apartment. During that night my sister sleeping outside on the pull out bed was coughing all night, the next day when the cleaner lady came in we asked if they could smell gas and she could get it straight away. We rang down to reception and they sent someone up straight away to fix the cooker and it turn out that the connection was fitted incorrectly and there was gas leaking. The staff in the hotel was so rude didn't offer us new room as they were fully booked up but when we rang our rep from our package company they rang the hotel and suddenly a room was available but didn't fit us all.
