review: Made reservation to stay EIGHT nights during College Parent's weekend and take days before and after the weekend. This place was rec'd by a family member who stayed ONE night.Did not realize that it was a very tiny place in a rather bad section of Boston. Security not great- doorman absent often as is front desk:( ie. anyone can walk in); Ask basic questions to front desk personnel about transportation, local attractions, dining, discounts available, and got no help. Did not even offer to find out an answer. They have two cheap stationary "iPads" that have touch screens that are almost impossible to work. I was having difficulty working it and asked the front desk manager who was literally five feet away and he tried to show me with his finger and did not even get up to assist. The" iPads" do not print anything. If you want anything printed you have to send a document as an email to the front desk and they will try to do it. There is real no lobby. There is a VERY TINY closet sized space where you can purchase coffee and snacks, no milk.Room was fine,clean, bed comfortable. But, very strange appliances- did not recognize names ( close out sale?) and microwave hard to work. TV fine but clicker did not work at first, had to have them work on it. First two days room was not cleaned. Had to have them come up at night w new towels/toilettries. When you leave your room the door does NOT SHUT all the way-- it rests on the lock. You have to wait till it gets to the lock and then push it shut. If you walk out quickly you would never know it. This is a SECURITY ISSUE.Gym is in the basement level and must have just been painted and reeked of fumes, no windows. Again, weird brand name treadmill and stepper; Treadmill comes to a complete STOP when your times is up and there is no "cool down" and couldn't figure how to work it to add a few minutes for a cool down. When I left the gym, noticed the back door out to the street was OPEN and air blowing it back and forth. NOTE:The elevator to all the floors two steps from OPEN DOOR.Looked around outside for perhaps a worker --- no one, just eerie neighborhood. So I shut the door. Went upstairs to front desk... nobody.... Saw someone out front and asked if he is the front desk person, and yes he was. Told him my safety concerns and he did not believe me. Told me there is no way the door would be open. And, there are security cameras at the front desk anyway ( Where NOBODY WAS!)Told him I would show him if he would escort me to the basement. He continued jokingly to tell me I must not have seen it properly and that it shuts.So, we go down he opens the door with his slide key and he swings it open and tells me to "Watch" and we watch as it slowly almost shuts but two inches before the end-- it remains open. He then tells me he is strong and can protect me. JOKE JOKE. I told him that this is a major security concern and it is not a joking matter. He says don't worry.I immediately called the 800 number for Choice hotels and by this time the Guest services/complaints Dept was closed and reservations could do nothing. I called in the morning and spoke to Guest Services and they said they would talk to the manager.Next morning on my way out I spoke to FOUR people at front desk, all very early twenties, (naive) about the safety issue and they stared at me like I was CRAZY. One girl actually had to cover her mouth from laughing. One man about twentysomething yrs old, as seriously as he could muster, commented that yes it was a security issue and it was being addressed.This is when I reported that my NINE night stay was being changed as I did not consider the place safe, and I was checking out the next day. ( MONEY LOSS). The manager than asked :"Is there anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable?" and, "Was your stay enjoyable?", I replied "NO, it wasn't and it is a bit too late to do anything now, thank you!"Got back to room and there was a bag filled with treats from the pantry and a note that said thank you for staying with us. Very nice, but really what they need to do is GET TRAINED ON HOW TO BE A PROFESSIONAL. Take security issues seriously. Keep the front desk manned if you depend on security cameras at night. Get off the phone when a paying customer is standing there over five minutes at the desk waiting to speak to you. Put a new phone call on hold when you are in the middle of answering a question instead of taking the call that ends up being ten minutes while the customer (ME) is standing there waiting for the rest of what you were saying. Learn to find answers to questions instead of saying. "Geez I don't really know', get off your butt and help customers when they have difficulty using the iPad, find out names of restaurants, find out local discounts that come with the Charlie Card, know when the "T" stops at the hotel and when it does not, find out if there is construction on "T" and routes are changed: BASIC THINGS customers expect from a supposedly "Boutique Upscale Hotel".Would never go back here again even though beds were great. I pay for more than beds.
response: We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your recent stay. Although I may have my opinion, I value yours and understand that you did not perceive the neighborhood to be safe. I can assure you that this is a very safe area and it will only improve in the years to come with new apartment and restaurant developments underway. To be honest, it is quite frustrating to hear these comments after I specifically went out of my way to ensure your satisfaction. It was not evident to me, or my fellow associates, that you were this unhappy with your experience. Not only is our desk always happy to help, but one associate specifically asking if you needed help with finding restaurants or travel directions and you declined. We offer the iPads as a unique business center option as space is limited in our lobby (as you mentioned). Most guests find them very easy to use and I‚Äôm sorry you were unable to print on them as they do print wirelessly to the front desk. I find it difficult to read the comments about our staff service as almost every guest makes a point to recognize how refreshing it is to find a cozy, affordable hotel that offers outstanding personalized service. Every staff member is personally selected and trained to go out of his or her way to assist all guests. I am glad that the comfort of our mattresses was the silver lining in your stay and I assure you that the in-room appliances are top notch in commercial options. I wish you the best in future travel plans and hope your family and friends back in the NJ area are safe and healthy.

review: I do not recommend staying at this hotel. Our room was not cleaned on a regular basis. Our second night, the hotel decided to put a group of teenagers on all the rooms on our floor. They were very loud around midnight, talking loudly in the hall and slamming doors, running to each others rooms and talking. No adult supervision. I tried to call the front desk, but no one answered.I complained about the noise and the fact that the front desk did not answer the phone the next day. We had a two-year-old child with us and the hotel was aware. Later a letter from the manager was distributed stating that after 8:00 p.m. was quiet time. It was still noisy. The hotel never monitored the floor, knowing that there were issues. They did not enforce their own policy, no security present.The front desk did not answer the phone in the evenings. There was no "mature" presence at the front desk or anywhere in the hotel. Supposedly the manager was onsite one day, but I never saw the person,The last night there was extremely loud between 11:00 and midnight. It was ridiculous that this group of immature and inconsiderate teenagers ruined our stay at this hotel. One was outside our door in the hall talking on the phone at midnight.I saw a Trip Advisor seal of excellence at the front desk and was amazed. The room was small and not comfortable. The lobby area was small, few services at the hotel, no restaurant. I would not ever stay at this hotel again, nor would I ever recommend it to anyone.
response: Greetings Harpist77,Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and I do apologize for the inconveniences you experienced. We take all your points very seriously and have addressed these concerns directly with the front desk and housekeeping team. As you mentioned, there is no need to have loud noise in the corridors especially that late at night.Once again I apologize and hope you will give us another chance to exceed your expectations.Regards,Lisa Marie
